com.radirius.mercury.framework

Class Core

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.radirius.mercury.framework.Core
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FrameBufferTest, GameStateTest, GraphicsTest

    public abstract class Core
extends Object
    The Core initializes the game, runs the game loop, and cleans up.
    Author:
    wessles, Jeviny, Sri Harsha Chilakapati

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean fullscreen
      Whether the window will attempt fullscreen

      The height of the window
      String name 
      protected boolean renderDebug
      Whether or not the debug data will be drawn to the screen.

      Whether or not the extra Mercury debug data will be shown in the console.
      protected int targetFps
      The target framerate.
      protected boolean vsync
      Whether or not v-sync is enabled
      protected int width
      The width of the window

      • init

        public abstract void init()
        Used to initialize all resources, and for whatever you wish to do for initialization. May run on a seperate thread, while the main Thread continues to the game loop.

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        Called once every frame and used to handle all game logic.

      • addDebugData

        public void addDebugData(String name,
                String value)
        Adds information to the debugdata. Debug data is wiped every single update frame, so this is to be called every frame.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the debug information
        value - The value of the debug information
